match.title: 3rd ODI
match.statusText: South Africa won by 4 runs (D/L method)

series.name: Sri Lanka tour of South Africa
series.longName: Sri Lanka tour of South Africa

match.hoursInfo: 14.30 start, First Session 14.30-18.00, Interval 18.00-18.45, Second Session 18.45-22.15

headshotImage.longCaption: Jeff Crowe player page headshot cutout, 2021

otherSerieses.name: Sri Lanka in South Africa ODI Series
otherSerieses.longName: Sri Lanka in South Africa ODI Series

headshotImage.longCaption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Colin Ingram player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Colin Ingram player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Upul Tharanga c Ingram b Peterson 58 (65b 5x4 2x6 90m) SR: 89.23

dismissalComment.html: eep, Sri Lanka have lost a wicket out of nowhere, just like that, it was becoming too easy for them, Tharanga went for a casual sweep, and the top edge is taken easily by short fine leg

dismissalText.commentary: Nuwan Kulasekara b M Morkel 40 (38b 1x4 1x6 59m) SR: 105.26

dismissalComment.html: got 'em! Morne gets the yorker on target, Nuwan misses for once as he clears the front leg and swings, and the stumps are rattled, but he's made more than his share of runs

headshotImage.caption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: South Africa continue to chip away at Sri Lanka, Morne has Chandimal hurried in to a pull to a pacy short ball from outside off, he ends up flailing at it, and the top edge is safely taken by Smith running to his right at mid off
got 'em! Morne gets the yorker on target, Nuwan misses for once as he clears the front leg and swings, and the stumps are rattled, but he's made more than his share of runs

headshotImage.caption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

dismissalComment.html: gone this time, South Africa hold on to a catch, Tsotsobe strikes with a slower one, Mathews ends up chipping it towards long on who comes forward to take a low catch

headshotImage.caption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Colin Ingram player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Colin Ingram player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Upul Tharanga c Ingram b Peterson 58 (65b 5x4 2x6 90m) SR: 89.23

dismissalComment.html: eep, Sri Lanka have lost a wicket out of nowhere, just like that, it was becoming too easy for them, Tharanga went for a casual sweep, and the top edge is taken easily by short fine leg

dismissalText.commentary: Tillakaratne Dilshan c Steyn b Duminy 33 (49b 2x4 0x6 101m) SR: 67.34

dismissalComment.html: spin strikes once again, the top edged sweep leads to the downfall of a SL batsman once again, Dilshan, who has batted with so much care, so much uncharacteristic caution, and just when he was starting to play his strokes, he sweeps a flighted delivery straight to Steyn at deep backward square leg, the fast bowler takes a neat tumbling catch

headshotImage.caption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Kumar Sangakkara run out (du Plessis) 38 (37b 3x4 1x6 46m) SR: 102.7

dismissalComment.html: top-class fielding, truly top stuff, Faf du Plessis is electric at backward point, Chandimal squeezed out this one to Faf's left and set off, so did Sanga, but Faf got down to his left and put in the dive to stop the ball, and let it rip, there was confusion among the batsman as soon as Faf stopped the ball, and before they could do anything, Faf uprooted the stumps at the striker's end with a ripper of a throw, he did not even wait for AB to come up to the stumps, he is mobbed by his team-mates

headshotImage.caption: Colin Ingram player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Colin Ingram player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Mahela Jayawardene run out (Ingram) 15 (19b 1x4 0x6 26m) SR: 78.94

dismissalComment.html: South Africa continue to show their class in the field with another run-out, Chandimal slapped it wide of mid off, Chandimal stopped after taking a step out, but Mahela had set off too far up and turned back late, was found way short of the direct hit

dismissalText.commentary: Angelo Mathews c Peterson b Tsotsobe 15 (14b 2x4 0x6 23m) SR: 107.14

dismissalComment.html: gone this time, South Africa hold on to a catch, Tsotsobe strikes with a slower one, Mathews ends up chipping it towards long on who comes forward to take a low catch

dismissalText.commentary: Nuwan Kulasekara b M Morkel 40 (38b 1x4 1x6 59m) SR: 105.26

dismissalComment.html: got 'em! Morne gets the yorker on target, Nuwan misses for once as he clears the front leg and swings, and the stumps are rattled, but he's made more than his share of runs

dismissalText.commentary: Lasith Malinga b Steyn 2 (4b 0x4 0x6 4m) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: done in by the full and slow delivery, Malinga was backing away all the time and was through with the slog before the ball arrived, Steyn finds the stumps

headshotImage.caption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Kosala Kulasekara run out (Tsotsobe/†de Villiers) 19 (20b 0x4 0x6 31m) SR: 95

dismissalComment.html: would have been a wide if he had not reached out to thick-edge it wide of third man, they go for the second, there is a dive too at the striker's, but AB has the stumps off in time

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

dismissalText.commentary: Faf du Plessis run out (Mathews/†Sangakkara) 72 (74b 7x4 0x6 99m) SR: 97.29

dismissalComment.html: they are running for everything, Faf was winded up after all that fielding and running and batting, and was found just short by an accurate throw that enabled Sanga to whip the bails off immediately, AB had set off after pushing on the off side and Faf had taken the cue and charged across, he has down on the ground after that run, and has to depart now, but played some fab shots

dismissalText.commentary: AB de Villiers not out 39 (36b 3x4 0x6 50m) SR: 108.33

headshotImage.caption: Graeme Smith player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Graeme Smith player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: through him! Malinga finds the right delivery, curling in full towards middle and leg, Smith was trying to work it across the line, left a huge gap between bat and pad, and allowed the ball to make a mess of his stumps

headshotImage.caption: Colin Ingram player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Colin Ingram player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: not the first batsman to be done in by the low slow dipping Malinga full toss, he was caught clueless by the delivery that seems harmless as it is slung in, but then dips teasingly as it approaches the batsman who ended up playing all over it, the ball goes on to strike the stumps low

headshotImage.caption: Alviro Petersen player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Alviro Petersen player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Dilshan strikes first ball! From around the stumps, Alviro goes for a reverse sweep, misses completely, given after a big appeal, SA ask for a review, that pitched in line with the stumps and ball tracker shows it going on to hit off and middle, not a great stroke to play against the offspinner first up, in hindsight

headshotImage.caption: Graeme Smith player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Graeme Smith player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Graeme Smith player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Graeme Smith player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Graeme Smith b Malinga 2 (13b 0x4 0x6 21m) SR: 15.38

dismissalComment.html: through him! Malinga finds the right delivery, curling in full towards middle and leg, Smith was trying to work it across the line, left a huge gap between bat and pad, and allowed the ball to make a mess of his stumps

headshotImage.longCaption: Colin Ingram player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.longCaption: Colin Ingram player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Colin Ingram b Malinga 13 (8b 3x4 0x6 9m) SR: 162.5

dismissalComment.html: not the first batsman to be done in by the low slow dipping Malinga full toss, he was caught clueless by the delivery that seems harmless as it is slung in, but then dips teasingly as it approaches the batsman who ended up playing all over it, the ball goes on to strike the stumps low

headshotImage.longCaption: Alviro Petersen player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Alviro Petersen player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Alviro Petersen player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Alviro Petersen lbw b Dilshan 17 (27b 1x4 0x6 57m) SR: 62.96

dismissalComment.html: Dilshan strikes first ball! From around the stumps, Alviro goes for a reverse sweep, misses completely, given after a big appeal, SA ask for a review, that pitched in line with the stumps and ball tracker shows it going on to hit off and middle, not a great stroke to play against the offspinner first up, in hindsight

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

dismissalText.commentary: Jean-Paul Duminy run out (KMDN Kulasekara) 25 (34b 2x4 0x6 49m) SR: 73.52

dismissalComment.html: that is a tight call, but Sri Lanka have come back through some tight fielding of their own, they lost their two top batsmen to run-outs today, but that is a very tight call from the third umpire, Nuwan let it rip with a direct hit from mid off as Duminy raced for the single, he looked to have just made it from the side angle, but from the straight angle, he looks to be just out, Kirsten looks annoyed, JP does not want to leave, he stops midway to the dressing room, looks back, holds up his arms, and finally trudges off, dragging his bat, with so much doubt about the decision, Duminy has got a rough one, ends a partnership that was beginning to bother Sri Lanka

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

dismissalText.commentary: Faf du Plessis run out (Mathews/†Sangakkara) 72 (74b 7x4 0x6 99m) SR: 97.29

dismissalComment.html: they are running for everything, Faf was winded up after all that fielding and running and batting, and was found just short by an accurate throw that enabled Sanga to whip the bails off immediately, AB had set off after pushing on the off side and Faf had taken the cue and charged across, he has down on the ground after that run, and has to depart now, but played some fab shots

batsmen.shot: off side drive on front foot

commentTextItems.html: dead-bats a full delivery aimed at the stumps, and calls an initially-hesitant Morkel across

headshotImage.caption: Albie Morkel player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Albie Morkel player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: goes on the pads with the full one and is turned to fine leg
squeezes a low full toss just past the non-striker's stumps
rips one in full but down the leg side
a clean pick-up at mid off would have found him short, that is, if the throw would have hit, it missed in the end

commentPreTextItems.html: Standing way outside his crease

commentTextItems.html: Malinga goes for the yorker, AB pats it away and they scamper across

commentPreTextItems.html: Some rain could be on its way
Malinga is back

commentTextItems.html: AB improvises, he bends his knee, and fetches a widish one from outside off and bunts it past the non-striker for a couple
extra cover is a bit deep and that is enough for them to pinch one

headshotImage.caption: Albie Morkel player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Albie Morkel player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: pushes a tossed up ball to the bowler
pushes towards cover off the front foot
AB opens up the off side, lofts inside out with the turn over extra cover
whips a low full toss off the pad to deep square

commentPreTextItems.html: Dave: "Geoff has a valid point. I seem to recall SA cruising in the last world cup until a de Villiers run out. Now who was running to the other end?"

commentTextItems.html: turned square on the leg side for one
slower one on the stumps that he drops behind square on the off side

headshotImage.caption: Albie Morkel player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Albie Morkel player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: now he shuffles across and works behind square leg for another boundary
shot! AB unfurls an extra cover drive that flies to the boundary, he makes a bit of room outside leg, and thwacks the ball with a bit of an open face
worked straight to midwicket again
fuller one slanted in, turned to midwicket
smack! sits up from back of a length, widish too, and AB hammers it past extra cover
goes past the outside edge with one that slides across him outside off

headshotImage.caption: Albie Morkel player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Albie Morkel player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentPreTextItems.html: Sri Lanka are 0-3 down with two games to go. The fourth ODI is in Kimberley on Friday, that will be a day-nighter too, so join us at 2 pm local time for that. Siddhartha Talya is updating his match report. That is it from me, Abhishek Purohit. Cheers

Faf du Plessis is the Man of the Match for his eye-catching 72. Faf: "Just nice to get some time in the middle, and the run out as well. There is skill involved but you count yourself lucky when you hit from that angle. I am grateful to AB and Kirsten to give me a chance up the order. It was serious cramping, AB told me its a mental thing and I need to harden up. I tried to but it kept coming and coming. We had AB in the middle still and I thought we could take the game."

AB de Villiers: "I would have liked the game to go the end. I am proud of the boys, we pulled it back with the ball and were solid with the bat, unfortunately there were a couple of run outs. Fielding is part and parcel of ODI cricket and can turn a game on its head. The whole team played really well. I thought the guys stuck to their plans really well. 260-odd wasn't a bad total for us. 300 was on the cards but we pulled it back really nicely. Alviro and Colin did not get too many but they looked good. Faf and JP settled things down nicely."

Dilshan: "Definitely disappointed to lose the series like this. I think we began really well, Mahela's and Sanga's run outs cost us 20 runs and that was the turning point. We also have to improve our fielding, South Africa are much better than us. We had a great chance to win today, with Lasith still having five overs with almost 90 runs to go. We'll try to finish strongly in the last two games."

10.50 pm It's off, finis, kaput. The match has ended. Really unfortunate way for Sri Lanka to lose the series. South Africa win by four runs under the D/L method. Well, someone had to be on the wrong side of the rain, and it cannot be South Africa all the time. They have been at the receiving end since 1992. But Sri Lanka looked like the better team today, they were one wicket away from getting into the SA tail, and Malinga had five overs to go.
10.45 pm Bad news for Sri Lanka, the rain has picked up again. Something tells me that's that
Mak: "It is late in India ! 2.14 now ! im still up hoping to see the latest record...the first ever time rain favoured SA !!! Ah AB ! You do DO IT ALL .. !"

10.30 pm The umpires are having a word with the groundsman. Apparently, it will take 40 minutes for the groundstaff to get the ground ready for play. The Supersopper is coming out now, but it is facing some issues getting started up, says Firdose.
Prithvi: "Wonder how rain can favour South Africa. Its against the laws of nature."
10.23 pm Mopping up operations have started, Firdose informs us. There is a lot of water on the covers, the umpires are having a look, umbrellas in hand. It is still raining a bit

Ritvik: "It's pretty late out here in India.. Have an exam tomo. And I woke my dad and brother out of their sleep to watch this match that looked likely to have a thrilling finish.. It was one over before rain struck. Now I'm being cursed. Wonder who's luck is worse..mine or the Sri Lankans'."
10.15 pm It's still raining, but it has eased off slightly, says Firdose. Cut-off time for the game is 11.26 pm
10.05 pm Still pouring, says Firdose. We'll start losing overs after around 10.30 pm
G&T goes back to 1992: "... and with one ball to go, South Africa now require 22 runs to win ..."
Firdose informs us that there will be an hour's delay allowed before they start docking overs. At the moment, it is pouring though
9.33 pm The rain has picked up and the umpires are having a chat. And they have decided to come off. South Africa are ahead on the D/L score at the moment - 175
Rain, D/L, South Africa, Sri Lanka - here is the scorecard of that 2003 World Cup match

headshotImage.longCaption: Colin Ingram player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Upul Tharanga c Ingram b Peterson 58 (65b 5x4 2x6 90m) SR: 89.23

dismissalComment.html: eep, Sri Lanka have lost a wicket out of nowhere, just like that, it was becoming too easy for them, Tharanga went for a casual sweep, and the top edge is taken easily by short fine leg

dismissalText.commentary: Tillakaratne Dilshan c Steyn b Duminy 33 (49b 2x4 0x6 101m) SR: 67.34

dismissalComment.html: spin strikes once again, the top edged sweep leads to the downfall of a SL batsman once again, Dilshan, who has batted with so much care, so much uncharacteristic caution, and just when he was starting to play his strokes, he sweeps a flighted delivery straight to Steyn at deep backward square leg, the fast bowler takes a neat tumbling catch

headshotImage.caption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Kumar Sangakkara run out (du Plessis) 38 (37b 3x4 1x6 46m) SR: 102.7

dismissalComment.html: top-class fielding, truly top stuff, Faf du Plessis is electric at backward point, Chandimal squeezed out this one to Faf's left and set off, so did Sanga, but Faf got down to his left and put in the dive to stop the ball, and let it rip, there was confusion among the batsman as soon as Faf stopped the ball, and before they could do anything, Faf uprooted the stumps at the striker's end with a ripper of a throw, he did not even wait for AB to come up to the stumps, he is mobbed by his team-mates

headshotImage.caption: Colin Ingram player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Colin Ingram player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Mahela Jayawardene run out (Ingram) 15 (19b 1x4 0x6 26m) SR: 78.94

dismissalComment.html: South Africa continue to show their class in the field with another run-out, Chandimal slapped it wide of mid off, Chandimal stopped after taking a step out, but Mahela had set off too far up and turned back late, was found way short of the direct hit

headshotImage.caption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Graeme Smith player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Graeme Smith player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Dinesh Chandimal c Smith b M Morkel 36 (54b 3x4 0x6 76m) SR: 66.66

dismissalComment.html: South Africa continue to chip away at Sri Lanka, Morne has Chandimal hurried in to a pull to a pacy short ball from outside off, he ends up flailing at it, and the top edge is safely taken by Smith running to his right at mid off

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

headshotImage.caption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Angelo Mathews c Peterson b Tsotsobe 15 (14b 2x4 0x6 23m) SR: 107.14

dismissalComment.html: gone this time, South Africa hold on to a catch, Tsotsobe strikes with a slower one, Mathews ends up chipping it towards long on who comes forward to take a low catch

dismissalText.commentary: Nuwan Kulasekara b M Morkel 40 (38b 1x4 1x6 59m) SR: 105.26

dismissalComment.html: got 'em! Morne gets the yorker on target, Nuwan misses for once as he clears the front leg and swings, and the stumps are rattled, but he's made more than his share of runs

dismissalText.commentary: Lasith Malinga b Steyn 2 (4b 0x4 0x6 4m) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: done in by the full and slow delivery, Malinga was backing away all the time and was through with the slog before the ball arrived, Steyn finds the stumps

headshotImage.caption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Kosala Kulasekara run out (Tsotsobe/†de Villiers) 19 (20b 0x4 0x6 31m) SR: 95

dismissalComment.html: would have been a wide if he had not reached out to thick-edge it wide of third man, they go for the second, there is a dive too at the striker's, but AB has the stumps off in time

headshotImage.caption: Graeme Smith player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Graeme Smith player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Graeme Smith player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Graeme Smith player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Graeme Smith b Malinga 2 (13b 0x4 0x6 21m) SR: 15.38

dismissalComment.html: through him! Malinga finds the right delivery, curling in full towards middle and leg, Smith was trying to work it across the line, left a huge gap between bat and pad, and allowed the ball to make a mess of his stumps

headshotImage.caption: Alviro Petersen player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Alviro Petersen player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Alviro Petersen player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Alviro Petersen player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Alviro Petersen lbw b Dilshan 17 (27b 1x4 0x6 57m) SR: 62.96

dismissalComment.html: Dilshan strikes first ball! From around the stumps, Alviro goes for a reverse sweep, misses completely, given after a big appeal, SA ask for a review, that pitched in line with the stumps and ball tracker shows it going on to hit off and middle, not a great stroke to play against the offspinner first up, in hindsight

headshotImage.caption: Colin Ingram player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Colin Ingram player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Colin Ingram player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Colin Ingram player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Colin Ingram b Malinga 13 (8b 3x4 0x6 9m) SR: 162.5

dismissalComment.html: not the first batsman to be done in by the low slow dipping Malinga full toss, he was caught clueless by the delivery that seems harmless as it is slung in, but then dips teasingly as it approaches the batsman who ended up playing all over it, the ball goes on to strike the stumps low

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

dismissalText.commentary: Faf du Plessis run out (Mathews/†Sangakkara) 72 (74b 7x4 0x6 99m) SR: 97.29

dismissalComment.html: they are running for everything, Faf was winded up after all that fielding and running and batting, and was found just short by an accurate throw that enabled Sanga to whip the bails off immediately, AB had set off after pushing on the off side and Faf had taken the cue and charged across, he has down on the ground after that run, and has to depart now, but played some fab shots

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

dismissalText.commentary: Jean-Paul Duminy run out (KMDN Kulasekara) 25 (34b 2x4 0x6 49m) SR: 73.52

dismissalComment.html: that is a tight call, but Sri Lanka have come back through some tight fielding of their own, they lost their two top batsmen to run-outs today, but that is a very tight call from the third umpire, Nuwan let it rip with a direct hit from mid off as Duminy raced for the single, he looked to have just made it from the side angle, but from the straight angle, he looks to be just out, Kirsten looks annoyed, JP does not want to leave, he stops midway to the dressing room, looks back, holds up his arms, and finally trudges off, dragging his bat, with so much doubt about the decision, Duminy has got a rough one, ends a partnership that was beginning to bother Sri Lanka

dismissalText.commentary: AB de Villiers not out 39 (36b 3x4 0x6 50m) SR: 108.33

headshotImage.caption: Albie Morkel player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Albie Morkel player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Albie Morkel not out 7 (12b 0x4 0x6 27m) SR: 58.33

headshotImage.longCaption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021

Powerplay 1: Overs 0.1 - 10.0 (Mandatory - 41 runs, 0 wicket)

Drinks: Sri Lanka - 66/0 in 14.0 overs (WU Tharanga 48, TM Dilshan 15)
Powerplay 2: Overs 15.1 - 20.0 (Bowling side - 33 runs, 1 wicket)
WU Tharanga: 50 off 54 balls (4 x 4, 2 x 6)
Sri Lanka: 100 runs in 18.6 overs (115 balls), Extras 6
Sri Lanka: 150 runs in 27.4 overs (167 balls), Extras 9
3rd Wicket: 50 runs in 50 balls (KC Sangakkara 32, LD Chandimal 15, Ex 3)
Drinks: Sri Lanka - 154/3 in 29.1 overs (LD Chandimal 16)
Powerplay 3: Overs 35.1 - 40.0 (Batting side - 30 runs, 2 wickets)
Sri Lanka: 200 runs in 39.1 overs (236 balls), Extras 9
Sri Lanka: 250 runs in 47.3 overs (286 balls), Extras 9
Innings Break: Sri Lanka - 266/9 in 50.0 overs (HMRKB Herath 1)
South Africa innings
Powerplay 1: Overs 0.1 - 10.0 (Mandatory - 41 runs, 2 wickets)

Over 12.1: Review by South Africa (Batting), Umpire - NJ Llong, Batsman - AN Petersen (Struck down)
Drinks: South Africa - 64/3 in 15.0 overs (F du Plessis 23, JP Duminy 7)
Powerplay 2: Overs 15.1 - 20.0 (Bowling side - 33 runs, 0 wicket)
South Africa: 100 runs in 20.5 overs (125 balls), Extras 2
4th Wicket: 50 runs in 57 balls (F du Plessis 31, JP Duminy 18, Ex 1)
F du Plessis: 50 off 55 balls (5 x 4)
South Africa: 150 runs in 29.4 overs (178 balls), Extras 3
Drinks: South Africa - 166/5 in 32.0 overs (AB de Villiers 30, JA Morkel 4)
Rain: South Africa - 179/5 in 34.0 overs (AB de Villiers 39, JA Morkel 7)

stories.title: Sri Lanka in South Africa, 2011-12
stories.subTitle: Third ODI
stories.summary: Wisden's review of the third ODI between South Africa and Sri Lanka, Bloemfontein, 2011-12

stories.title: Selection decisions reveal long-term plans
stories.subTitle: South Africa v Sri Lanka, 4th ODI, Kimberly
stories.seoTitle: South Africa v Sri Lanka, 4th ODI: Selection decisions reveal long-term plans
stories.summary: A policy of rotation seems forward planning in the extreme for South Africa, but it is a step that is necessary for this team

image.caption: Gary Kirsten inspects the conditions at Kingsmead
image.longCaption: Gary Kirsten inspects the conditions at Kingsmead, Durban, December 24, 2011

stories.title: We showed a lot of maturity - de Villiers
stories.subTitle: South Africa v Sri Lanka , 3rd ODI, Bloemfontein
stories.seoTitle: South Africa v Sri Lanka , 3rd ODI, Bloemfontein: We showed a lot of maturity - AB de Villiers
stories.summary: In the space of a week, AB de Villiers has gone from captaining a team for the first time at any level, to winning an international series with two matches to spare

image.caption: Faf du Plessis plays a cover drive
image.longCaption: Faf du Plessis plays a cover drive, South Africa v Sri Lanka, 3rd ODI, Bloemfontein, January 17, 2012

stories.title: Dilshan rues Duckworth-Lewis denouement
stories.subTitle: South Africa v Sri Lanka, 3rd ODI, Bloemfontein
stories.seoTitle: South Africa v Sri Lanka, 3rd ODI: Dilshan rues Duckworth-Lewis denouement
stories.summary: Had it not rained, and if the full 50 overs of the South African innings had been bowled, Tillakaratne Dilshan may have been able to smile whole-heartedly for the first time this year

image.caption: After ducks in the first two ODIs, Tillakaratne Dilshan made his first runs of the series
image.longCaption: After ducks in the first two ODIs, Tillakaratne Dilshan made his first runs of the series, South Africa v Sri Lanka, 3rd ODI, Bloemfontein, January 17, 2012

stories.title: Dilshan stops the rot and an eerie déjà vu

stories.title: Tight Duckworth-Lewis win gives South Africa series
stories.subTitle: South Africa v Sri Lanka, 3rd ODI, Bloemfontein
stories.seoTitle: South Africa v Sri Lanka, 3rd ODI: Tight Duckworth-Lewis win gives South Africa series
stories.summary: South Africa took an unassailable 3-0 lead, with the result settled in anti-climatic fashion by the Duckworth-Lewis method after thundershowers interrupted play

image.caption: Faf du Plessis plays a cover drive
image.longCaption: Faf du Plessis plays a cover drive, South Africa v Sri Lanka, 3rd ODI, Bloemfontein, January 17, 2012

stories.title: Sri Lanka looking to touch 250
stories.subTitle: South Africa v Sri Lanka, 3rd ODI, Bloemfontein
stories.seoTitle: South Africa v Sri Lanka, 3rd ODI, Bloemfontein: Sri Lanka looking to touch 250
stories.summary: Sri Lanka have one important target in their minds ahead of what could be a series-decider in Bloemfontein: to put at least 250 runs on the board

image.caption: Angelo Mathews walks back after being caught short of the crease
image.longCaption: Angelo Mathews walks back after being caught short of the crease, Pakistan v Sri Lanka, 1st ODI, Dubai, November 11, 2011

stories.title: South Africa's brave new world of experimentation
stories.subTitle: South Africa v Sri Lanka, 3rd ODI, Bloemfontein
stories.seoTitle: South Africa v Sri Lanka, 3rd ODI: South Africa's brave new world of experimentation
stories.summary: 'Cautious over curious' has usually been the approach of the South African selectors. Instead of being dynamic and open-minded they have traditionally acted in a risk averse manner, until now
